course_title: Special Topics: Film and Media: Queer Visions
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 12 / Seats Avail: 0Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
This course explores the way that film and media can be seen as queer practice or as forms that can be queered (effecting a divergence from the norm). Weekly screenings representing a diverse range of queer aesthetic practices will be paired with readings and discussions about representations of LGBTQ+ people and the intersections with identity, race, and gender. Students will create their own queer(ed) texts in the form of moving image projects grappling with visions of LGBTQ+ people. 
MCP Elective
course_description: Rotating topics in film and media. May be repeated for credit when the topic varies.
prerequisites: FILM 101 or FILM_OX 101 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
